ITEM 1. BUSINESS.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART I - ITEM 1. BUSINESS section of Uber's business information, formatted as bullet points:

• Uber Technologies, Inc. is a technology platform that connects consumers with independent providers of ride services and merchants with delivery service providers.
• The company operates in over 70 countries around the world, principally in the United States and Canada, Latin America, Europe (excluding Russia), the Middle East, Africa, and Asia Pacific (APAC).
• As of December 31, 2024, Uber had three operating and reportable segments: Mobility, Delivery, and Freight.
• The Mobility segment connects consumers with a wide range of transportation modalities, including ridesharing, carsharing, micromobility, rentals, public transit, taxis, and more.
• As of December 31, 2024, Uber's Mobility segment had three operating and reportable segments: Mobility, Delivery, and Freight.

ITEM 1A. RISK FACTORS.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART I - ITEM 1A. RISK FACTORS section of UBER's Annual Report on Form 10-K:

• The mobility, delivery, and logistics industries are highly competitive, with well-established and low-cost alternatives that have been available for decades.

• Low barriers to entry, low switching costs, and well-capitalized competitors in nearly every major geographic region make it challenging for Uber to compete.

• Uber has incurred significant losses, including in the United States and other major markets.

• The company expects its operating expenses to increase in the foreseeable future and may not maintain profitability.

• A critical mass of Drivers, consumers, merchants, Shippers, and Carriers is essential for the platform's appeal, and losing this critical mass could harm the business.

• Retaining and attracting high-quality personnel is crucial to Uber's success, and continued attrition or unsuccessful succession planning could adversely affect the business.

• The company relies heavily on its brand and reputation, which can be affected by media coverage, including negative publicity.

• Autonomous vehicle technologies are a key area of focus for Uber, but there are risks associated with their development and implementation.

• Uber's historical workplace culture and forward-leaning approach have created operational, compliance, and cultural challenges that may not be fully addressed.

ITEM 1C. CYBERSECURITY.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - ITEM 1C. CYBERSECURITY section in bullet points:

• The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) has served as the head of Uber's cybersecurity program since February 2021 and has over 20+ years of engineering and/or cybersecurity experience.

• The CISO is supported by the Chief Privacy Officer, who has served in that role since August 2018 and has over three decades of experience as a legal advisor to multinational corporations.

• Uber's Board of Directors oversees the cybersecurity program through regular updates, including presentations by the CISO to the Board and Audit Committee on an alternating quarterly basis.

• The cybersecurity program includes internally conducted environment and vulnerability assessments performed by security engineering teams, which are reported to senior management and the Board or Audit Committee.

• Uber undergoes annual audits to maintain its certification as a Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS 4.0) Level 1 Merchant and Service provider.

• The cybersecurity program also includes independent third-party audits and assessments by industry-leading firms, such as SOC 2 attestations that vary depending on the Uber product.

• Cyber incident management is handled by Uber's security engineering team at the direction of the CISO, which includes efforts to review potential incidents.

ITEM 2. PROPERTIES.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - ITEM 2. PROPERTIES in bullet points:

• As of December 31, 2024, UBER leased and owned office facilities around the world totaling 8.8 million square feet.
• The company owns 2.1 million square feet for its corporate headquarters in the San Francisco Bay Area, California.

ITEM 3. LEGAL PROCEEDINGS.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - ITEM 3. LEGAL PROCEEDINGS in bullet points:

• In May 2019, an Australian law firm filed a class action lawsuit against Uber and its subsidiaries in the Supreme Court of Victoria, Australia.
• The plaintiff alleges that Uber conspired to injure taxi drivers in Australia between 2014 and 2017, causing loss and damage to them.
• Four additional class action lawsuits were filed by the same law firm in March, April, and October 2020, alleging the same claim.
• In December 2024, the Supreme Court of Victoria approved a settlement with no admission of liability by Uber, subject to any appeals and approval by the Supreme Court of Western Australia.

ITEM 5. MARKET FOR REGISTRANT’S COMMON E.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - ITEM 5. MARKET FOR REGISTRANT’S COMMON EQUITY, RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS AND ISSUER PURCHASES OF EQUITY SECURITIES in bullet points:

• Our common stock has been listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the symbol "UBER" since May 10, 2019.
• As of February 11, 2025, there were 1,249 holders of record of our common stock.
• The actual number of stockholders is greater than the number of record holders and includes beneficial owners with shares held in street name by brokers and nominees.
• We have never declared or paid cash dividends on our capital stock.
• Our board of directors authorized the repurchase of up to $7.0 billion in shares of our outstanding common stock in February 2024.
• The average price paid per share for share repurchases during the three months ended December 31, 2024 was excluded from broker commissions and fees.

ITEM 7. MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANAL.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART II - ITEM 7. MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS section of UBER's Annual Report on Form 10-K in bullet points:

• The company is involved in numerous legal proceedings globally, including putative class and collective class action lawsuits, demands for arbitration, charges and claims before administrative agencies, and investigations or audits by labor, social security, and tax authorities.

• On May 5, 2020, the California Attorney General filed a complaint against Uber and Lyft, Inc. alleging that drivers are misclassified, seeking an injunction and monetary damages related to the alleged competitive advantage caused by the alleged misclassification of drivers.

• To comply with Proposition 22, Uber has incurred and expects to incur additional expenses, including expenses associated with a guaranteed minimum earnings floor for Drivers, insurance for injury protection, and subsidies for health care.

• If required to classify Drivers as employees, workers, or quasi-employees, Uber would incur significant additional expenses.

• The company does not expect these changes to have a material impact on its business, results of operations, financial position, or cash flows.

ITEM 7A. QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DI.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - ITEM 7A. QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK in bullet points:

• As of June 30, 2024, UBER had approximately $1.97 billion in aggregate principal amount outstanding of the 2030 Refinanced Term Loans.
• In September 2024, UBER fully repaid all loans outstanding under this term loan agreement.
• As of December 31, 2024, UBER has no drawn amounts on its new Credit Agreement.
• A hypothetical 100 basis point increase in interest rates would have decreased the fair value of UBER's fixed rate notes by $461 million as of December 31, 2024.
• UBER had cash and cash equivalents totaling $7.0 billion and $8.6 billion as of December 31, 2023 and December 31, 2024, respectively.
• Marketable debt securities classified as restricted investments and short-term investments totaled $8.1 billion as of December 31, 2024.
• UBER does not enter into investments for trading or speculative purposes.
• A hypothetical 100 basis point change in interest rates would not have a material effect on UBER's financial results due to the relatively short-term nature of its investments.
• As of December 31, 2024, the carrying value of UBER's investments was $8.8 billion, including equity method investments.

ITEM 8. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEM.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - ITEM 8. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA section, formatted as bullet points:

• As of December 31, 2024 and 2023, Uber Technologies, Inc.'s consolidated balance sheets presented fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the Company.
• The results of Uber's operations and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2024 conformed to accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
• As of December 31, 2024, Uber maintained effective internal control over financial reporting.
• The Company's management was responsible for the consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting.
• The audit firm conducted its audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB).
• The audit firm obtained reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statements were free of material misstatement, whether due to error or fraud.

ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES section, formatted as bullet points:

• UBER maintains disclosure controls and procedures designed to provide reasonable assurance that information required to be disclosed in reports is recorded, processed, summarized, and reported within specified time periods.
• The company's management, including the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, evaluated the effectiveness of its disclosure controls and procedures as of December 31, 2024, and concluded they are effective at a reasonable assurance level.
• There were no changes to UBER's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the quarter ended December 31, 2024 that have materially affected or are reasonably likely to affect its internal control over financial reporting.
• Management believes that the company's disclosure controls and procedures and internal control over financial reporting provide reasonable assurance of achieving their objectives, but not absolute assurance against errors or fraud.
• UBER's management conducted an assessment of its internal control over financial reporting based on the criteria established in "Internal Control - Integrated Framework" (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission, and concluded that it was effective as of December 31, 2024.

OTHER INFORMATION.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the PART II - OTHER INFORMATION section in bullet points:

• Dara Khosrowshahi entered into a pre-arranged stock trading plan on November 7, 2024.
• The plan allows for the potential sale of up to 350,000 shares of Uber common stock between February 6, 2025 and March 1, 2026.
• Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah entered into a pre-arranged stock trading plan on December 17, 2024.
• The plan allows for the potential sale of up to 11,000 shares of Uber common stock between March 17, 2025 and March 16, 2026.

ITEM 10. DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS A.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART III - ITEM 10. DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE in bullet points:

• The Company has adopted an insider trading policy governing the purchase, sale, and other dispositions of its securities.
• A copy of the Company's insider trading policy is filed with this Annual Report on Form 10-K as Exhibit 19.1.
• The Company follows procedures for the repurchase of its securities.
• The Company believes its insider trading policy and repurchase procedures are reasonably designed to promote compliance with insider trading laws, rules, and regulations.
• A copy of the 2025 Proxy Statement, which includes information on Proposal 1- Election of Directors, Executive Officers, Corporate Governance, and other governance matters, is incorporated by reference.
